direction.raw_text: Get this infernal creature off me. The WHINE is growing louder. it seems to be coming from above. THE CEILING-CLOSE. There, in the corner, the membrane covering the hole seems to be trembling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This can't be good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have a remarkably keen sense of the obvious. INT.-JUPITER TWO Maureen stands with Penny at the main sensor station.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: John, get the hell out of there. ON SCREEN. The silver disks on the hull of the probe ship are beginning to move, rising to stand now on spindraled legs. EXT.-PROBE SHIP Heads and legs emerging, the disks reveal themselves to be armor plated spiders. The monsters find viscous holes in the outer hull and push through, vanishing into the probe ship. INT.-JUPITER TWO (OVER) a THUD. The Jupiter Two shakes, as if struck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give me an external view. Penny works the console. ON SCREEN. Spiders are leaping from the probe onto the Jupiter Two. INT.-PROBE SHIP-BRIDGE The lizard monkey's SCREAMING has reached new heights of hysteria. A shape begins to push through the viscous bole in the ceiling. What bursts in is a monster out of nightmare. Nearly half the size of a human, shiny metallic body from which wet, spider-like limbs extend. A fang covered vAw opens below ravenous, green eyes. Don draws his laser and FIRES, but the blast only reflects off the metallic surface of its torso, forcing the creature to retract its limbs and eyes, hiding within its protective shell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evacuate. Now! The team races for the door as several more spiders drop through the hole in the ceiling, landing in the bridge and scampering fast towards our fleeing heros. INT.-PROBE SHIP-TUNNELS The boarding party race down the corridor. The spiders are bounding after them, using walls, floor, and ceiling with equal facility. INT.-JUPITER TWO Will is madly working his keyboard, controlling the fleeing Robot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This joy stick is too slow. Activate holographic interface. A holographic robot appears on the bridge. Will steps inside, the image now moving with his body. He spins, facing backwards, firing. INT.-PROBE SHIP The Robot is holding up the rear, its torso swiveled backwards so it can retreat and FIRE simultaneously. The Robot's plasma BLASTS have more effect than-the lasers, blowing the spiders into tiny pieces of inhuman flesh and metal. But more monsters are pouring through the holes in the corridor ceiling, some giving chasing, others swarming injured comrades. Judy watches as several spiders devour their fallen brethren.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They eat their wounded. Our heroes race to a nexus, corridors leading off in all directions. Spiders are dropping from the ceiling around them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which way? INT. -JUPITER TWO WILL-POV. A graphic map flashes within the holograph.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Turn left. INT.-PROBE SHIP-CORRIdOR
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now right. The spiders are swarming, closing fast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got to seal the bulkhead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The door control is at the other and of the corridor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The fire sensor. Judy pulls her gun, FIRES, hitting a ceiling sensor at the end of the corridor. Blast doors SLAM, sealing out most of the spiders. DON-CLOSE. Impressed. BLAST DOORS-CLOSE. Metal teeth begin tearing through the steel. Our group has made it to the door to the docking bay. They rush in, the Robot coming through the open doorway last and holding there. INT.-PROBE SHIP-DOCKING BAY Don activates the airlock to the Jupiter, the batch slowly opening. The Robot stands in the doorway to the docking bay, FIRING at the spiders as they come down the hall, blowing them away. More pour through the now rending blast doors. There are just too many, rolling towards them now like a single, shifting mass of death.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Open, damn you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's cycling a vacuum check. There is no way to speed up the protocols.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fools. I warned you not to come aboard this cursed craft. You've killed us. You've killed us all. Judy throws him, hard, into the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now that's a bedside manner. The first spiders reach the Robot, leaping onto its metal bull. INT.-JUPITER TWO Maureen and Penny are at the Com, powering up the engines. Will is within the holograph, fighting off the spiders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charge. INT.-PROBE SHIP-DOCKING BAY The Robot's shell electrifies, the spiders recoiling. The airlock has opened enough for our heroes to duck inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will, get the Robot in here. The Robot stands in the open portal, covered by spiders, their fangs shredding his hull, his electrical charge beginning to SHORT. INT.-JUPITER TWO Will is throwing off the monsters, Extending the Robot's antenna spikes and scanner dishes to skewer spiders that are squeezing by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't move him without letting the spiders into the ship. INT.-PROBE SHIP-DOCKING BAY JOHN Leave him behind. INT.-JUPITER TWO WILL I'm sorry, Robot. INT.-JUPITER TWO-DOCKING BAY A spider pushes past the Robot, head slipping around his metallic body, bent on reaching the airlock and the crew within. INT.-JUPITER TWO-AIRLOCK JOHN Seal it. Now! Don hits a switch just as a spider breaks free, rushing towards the dropping airlock door. Smith recoils from the swiping talon. SMITH'S BACK-CLOSE. A tiny rand and beneath, a razor thin incision. THE DOOR drops, the spider's arm, still twitching, severed inside the airlock. INT.-JUPITER TWO The inner airlock door Opens. The crew tumble in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get us out of here. Don is already powering up the ship's engines as Smith tries separating himself from the tiny lizard monkey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get this cloying gargoyle off of me. He throws the beast hard across the bridge. The creature hits the wall, SCREECHING, begins racing across consoles. John has strapped in beside Don.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get me an external view. A MONITOR shows the hull of the Jupiter Two. More spiders are leaping onto the ship, attaching themselves to the hull.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Prepare to disengage. THE LIZARD MONKEY skitters up the back of Penny's chair, over her head, getting tangled in her hair before jumping into her lap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get it off me. Get it off. Penny in frantically wiping the hair from her face. The tiny creature on her lap begins a perfect imitation of Penny. Don releases the docking ring, glances at the Monitor. The hull of the ship is now entirely covered with spiders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Initiating separation. LIZARD MONKEY'S EYES widen in terror as the ship SHAKES, burying its head in Penny's chest. A beat. Then Penny hugs the tiny beast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's okay. Everything's going to be alright. But she sounds anything but sure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're clear. Everybody hang on. INT.-JUPITER TWO The Jupiter Two's engines BLOW, peeling into the endless night. INT.-JUPITER TWO (OVER) ALARMS sound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think those things were using the probe ship as a way to trap food.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That I s probably what happened to the monkey's parents. We were going to be desert.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But what happened to the crew?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're not out of the woods yet. ON SCREEN. The hull of the Jupiter Two is covered with the giant spiders, their teeth cutting through the outer hull.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's see how these monsters like a hundred thousand volts. EXT.-JUPITER TWO The hull glows with electricity. The spiders fly off into space, their limbs and heads retracting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the crowd goes wild.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Recall your nightmares from childhood, Major. Monsters are rarely so easily dissuaded. (OVER) a THUNK. Then another. A third. ON SCREEN-The spiders shoot webs from their bellies, attaching to the Jupiter, land on the hull again, re-extending their limbs, starting to burrow once more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Persistent bastards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you hit them again?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Every time I electrify the hull, I'm draining our systems. Once or twice more and we're going to be dead in space.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A fate I fear may be inevitable one way or another. Maureen emerges from the airlock holding the spider's severed limb in metal tongs. Carries it to her life sciences analyzer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's the same expression you had when my mother came to stay with us. MAUREEN'S MONITOR-CLOSE. A graphic of the severed spider leg. A small line begins to extrapolate to the rest of the figure. Musculature and flesh are drawn in on the screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: extrapolation - coming up. Silicone based. Admantium shell and lack of respiratory system suggest an ability to live in deep space. Tiny front brain implies communal relationships. More like bees. VIEWS CREEN -CLOSE. More and more spider are spiraling from the probe ship, all heading toward the Jupiter Two.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are thousands of those things Maureen is working the COMPUTER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They may be attracted to heat and light. Don begins typing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With the right command codes, I can light up the probe ship from here. MONITOR-CLOSE. More spiders are hitting the bull.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn. No response.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Command codes are sequenced. Try the next series.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But they won't work until the next fleet of ships are built. That's at least two years away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just do it. Don begins entering command codes. The mighty probe ship begins to power up, engines glowing red as they begin their initial BURN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How did you know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Think about it, Don. The ships's advanced technology. Your friend looking old. What if that ship is from our future?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Warning. Outer hull has been compromised. SCREEN-CLOSE. Spiders are eating through the outer hull.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not working.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you get the fusion drive on line? EXT.-SPACE THE PROBE SHIP'S fusion drives FIRE. A few of the spiders divert back toward the probe ship. But most still head for the Jupiter. INT.-JUPITER TWO WEST Let's turn up the heat. Don engages the THRUSTERS, grabs the throttle. EXT.-SPACE The Jupiter Two banks toward the probe ship, heading directly for the wake of the fusion drives. INT.-JUPITER TWO COMPUTER (OVER) Warning. Inner hull breach in twenty seconds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give them a little encouragement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Electrifying outer hull ... now. EXT.-JUPITER TWO The outer bull flashes with electricity, the spiders jumping off. Don pilots the craft directly through the wake of the fusion drive. The spiders jump off, begin attaching themselves to the nacelles of the giant probe ship. INT.-JUPITER TWO ON SCREEN the giant spiral of spiders in now heading back towards the giant probe ship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get us out of here. Fast. Don looks at John a beat, then he begins working the controls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never leave an enemy stronghold intact. One of your father's first rules of engagement. Don hits a button. On the remote control console a readout begins to flash. The message is simple: FUSION DRIVE-OVERLOAD.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don, stop. That's a direct order. We might need to salvage-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is a military emergency. That means I'm in command.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don, no. I'm ordering you-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hate spiders. Don hits a button. The panel light flashes: OVERLOAD.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hang on, it I a gonna be a bumpy ride. Don angles the ship away, punching the thrusters as the probe ship's engines begins to glow. EXT.-SPACE The probe ship's nuclear core overloads. The engines begin to glow, venting plasma and then EXPLODE like a nascent star. THE BLAST WAVE spreads across space, vaporizing the spiders. THE BLAST WAVE hits the Jupiter Two. INT.-JUPITER TWO The ship is buffeted by the shock wave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't hold her. EXT.-JUPITER TWO The ship is knocked into the atmosphere of the giant planet below. INT.-JUPITER TWO Don is struggling to keep control.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're going down. EXT.-JUPITER TWO The ship is hurling toward the planet's cloud obscured surface. INT.-JUPITER TWO The windscreen is filled with a RUSHING BLIZZARD.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't get the stabilizers on line.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pull up. Pull up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really? No kidding? Thanks. WINDSCREEN- CLOSE. The storm clouds suddenly PART TO REVEAL ... A GIANT SNOW COVERED MOUNTAIN RANGE. Don banks the controls. EXT.-JUPITER TWO The ship tilts on its side, passing between two snowy peaks, still plunging towards the planet's wintry surface below. INT.-JUPITER TWO WEST I'm reading a clearing ahead. I'm going to try and make it. EXT.-PLANET'S SURFACE The Jupiter Two BLOWS over a carpet of snowy treetops, the canopy of leaves bursting into flames from the friction of the hull. INT.-JUPITER TWO The surface is coming up fast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got to slow us down. EXT.-PLANET'S SURFACE The Jupiter Two hits the surf ace of the water and skips, once twice, three times across the alien sea. INT.-JUPITER TWO WEST Brace for impact! The ship SMASHES into a crater miles long, PLOWING through rock and vegetation, finally coming to rest near one of the crater walls. INT.-JUPITER TWO Still. Automatic fire systems spray gas everywhere. only the dimmest emergency lights cast any glow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everybody, by the numbers. Maureen straightens, rubs her neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Life Sciences, still breathing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mission medical, I'm alive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me too. Robotics, I mean.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Video Mechanics, okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm alive, Major West's poor excuse for piloting skills not withstanding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's take a look. Don hits a switch, the windshield de-icing, becoming clear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think we're in Kansas anymore. REVERSE ANGLE Before them lies the crater, snow covered floor spreading out towards a distant horizon stained red by two hanging crimson suns. CHAPTER 15: Follow Orders! -------------------------- EXT. -ALIEN LANDSCAPE-NIGHT The moonless sky is filled with an utterly alien starfield. The Jupiter Two sits near the wall of the crater, its tiny lights fighting the otherworldly darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You violated a direct order. INT.-ENGINE ROOM Cavernous. John and Don stand by the giant drive engines. Don is holding a cylinder containing a mixture of power chips, some glowing with radioactive fire, others dull and charred as coal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: About half the core material is burned out. We'll never generate enough power to break orbit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you not to blow that ship's reactors and you did it anyway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, Professor, give it a rest. I was technically still in command.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't hand me that. I'm commander of this mission.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, no offense, but you're an egghead with an honorary rank. No one ever intended you to handle combat situations. You're spouting some nonsense about- time travel while those spiders posed a continuing threat. I made a judgement call and if I have to I'll make it again. Hell, you of all people should understand that. If your father were here-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My father is not here. My father is dead, killed in one of his combat missions you so admire. My family is on this ship And you're going to follow my orders. Whether you agree with them or not. Is that clear, Major? Don's face is right up in John's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Save the speeches. I like you. But the fate of the Earth is at stake here. I'm going to do whatever I think it takes to ensure the success of this mission. With or without your help. Is that clear, Professor? The two are too close to do anything but kiss or fight. Kissing seems less than likely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Am I interrupting something? WIDER. Maureen stands in the doorway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Really. I think you two should go ahead and slug it out. I mean, here we are stranded on an alien world and you boys want to get into a pissing contest. So please, go for it. I'll have Judy down here in a heartbeat to declare you both unfit and I'll take over this mission. Now I don't want to hear another word from you two until you can play nice. Is that clear?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maureen- Listen-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not another word. (a beat) Better. Now if you've finished hosing down the decks with testosterone, I suggest you come with me. I may have found a way to get us off this planet. Maureen turns on her heal and EXITS. The two men exchange a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me about it. They head after her. CHAPTER 18: Danger Will! (Out of Sequence in screenplay.) ------------------------ INT:-WILL'S CABIN Will sits working over his hacker's deck. (OVER) STATIC.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you hear me? Robot? Will tunes the deck. More STATIC. Then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Systems error. Robot unable to register neural net outputs. Unable to locate motor controls. Unable-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Calm down. Your body was destroyed in the conflict with the space spiders. Do you remember?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Affirmative.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I downloaded your neural net.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Robot tried to destroy the Robinson family. Why would Will Robinson save Robot's personality? Your actions do not compute.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess sometimes friendship means acting with your heart, not your head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Logic error. Friendship does not compute.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry, Robot. Im going to build you a new body. I promise. Will turns to face a pile of pirated components from various par of the ship. He lifts a circular bubble of diodes. Smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mom always said I should try to make new friends. CHAPTER 15: Follow Orders! * return to CHAPTER -------------------------- INT.-BRIDGE Maureen stands at her life sciences station with John and Don.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The atmosphere here can sustain human life. I've located 500 Rads radioactive material a mile north.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's at least what we'd need to get the core functioning again. John looks out the viewscreen at the alien night. Turns to Don.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll set off at daybreak. it'll be safer. Those are my orders, Major.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I agree with your recommendation, Professor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: DZtente is a beautiful thing. INT.-SICK BAY Judy examines the lizard monkey. Penny strokes the tiny creature, producing a string of BLIPS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the diagnosis, Doc? Is it cowboy or ballerina on Halloween?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right now she's a girl. But I think your little pal here is from a self-replicating species. At different stages of life she, or he, probably alternates sexes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Imagine the savings on dating outfits alone. The tiny creature has begun playing with an aural scanner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I keep her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Penny, you've never taken care of a thing in your life besides yourself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please. She's all alone. I promise I'll look after her. She needs me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...The moment you misplace her, or forget to feed her, we leave her on this planet where she can live in the wild. I'm not kidding Penny. And with that Judy EXITS. Penny sits, stroking the tiny creature.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're both a long way from home, aren't we little one? The creature makes a tiny BLIP.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's what we'll call you. Blip. Blip reaches out, touches a green ribbon around Penny's wrist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You like that? Penny takes the ribbon off, ties it around Blip's wrist. Blip looks up, eyes glowing. Penny caresses the tiny creature's cheek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice girl. Pretty girl. Nice. The creature reaches up, touches Penny's cheek. Her tiny tongue trying to imitate Penny's words of comfort. PULL BACK TO REVEAL Judy stands, just out of sight, watching her sister, smiling. CHAPTER 16: Alien World ----------------------- INT.-JUPITER TWO-MED LAB Don shoves an indignant Smith into the room, adjusts a newly installed security panel in the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Remove that lock this instant. I shall not be caged like some animal
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (lethal) I gave my word I'd let you live. I never said for how long.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These quarters will be fine. Smith stares at him a beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me, Major West. Are you really confident in Robinson's ability to guide us? If I were set free, I would support your right to command. With minimal force, we could take this ship and assure this mission continues under your leadership.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...My God Smith, you're right. How could I have been so blind? I'll just run and get you a gun so we can hijack the ship. Okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sarcasm is the recourse of a weak mind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm hiding the pain. Really. And with that West leaves. Smith tries the door. Locked. Then, from one cuff of his field suit, be removes the control belt he stole from the probe ship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I assure you, Major West. Your pain has just begun. Smith moves about the room, lifting small bits of metal, creating an impromptu set of tools with which to alter the control bolt. PAN DOWN. HOLD on SMITH'S BACK. Beneath the rend in his suit, the tiny tear in his flesh is now covered with tiny, alien scales. INT. -BRIDGE-NIGHT Judy sits in one of the command chairs over a the remains of a meal, sipping water, staring out into the alien night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Star light, star bright...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A million strange stars and only one wish. I wish we were home. Don comes and sits in the co-pilot's chair beside her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never thought a sky could look so alien. ...We really are lost.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When the first sailors circled the globe and saw a brand new sky, they thought they had sailed off the edge of the earth. But they were really just around the corner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiles) We just billow our sails and let the wind blow us home, Is that it Major?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So those sailors found familiar shapes in the stars to make the skies more friendly, to help them find their way. Don turns on a monitor below the viewscreen. MONITOR-CLOSE. It shows the star-field above. He lifts a light-tipped stylus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's how constellations were born. Don begins to draw on the screen, connecting the stars like dots in a children's book. Slowly, a familiar porcine face takes form.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Porky the wise and mighty Pig. Judy LAUGHS. She takes the stylus. Begins to draw.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The great bucktoothed Bunny... Bugs. Don smiles. Judy can't help but smile back. Their faces are close.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, my quarters or yours?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are the only single man and woman of consenting age in the galaxy. How much more of a set up do you need?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you figure just dispense with the pleasantries, get down to business?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have a way with words, Doctor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (provocative) Right here? On this console? Don moves his face to hers, only a breath apart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here would be fine. Judy smiles sweetly. DON-CLOSE. Lips parting. Suddenly water begins to pour down over his head. His eyes open wide. Judy holds her empty glass in hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Next time, fly slower. She rises, walks off, leaving Don mopping his brow. INT.-JOHN & MAUREEN'S QUARTERS Maureen sits on the edge of her bed brushing her hair as John activates the automated security systems.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was I thinking, bringing us all out here into space?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The world needed saving. You were the right man for the job.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But solving the world's problems doesn't leave much time for the people you love, does it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you get any time with Will?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now he's decided he can rebuild the robot. Wants to show me his designs. I've got too much to do-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Funny creatures, men. You try so hard not to be your fathers, end up making the same mistakes. Will adores you. He needs your attention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can't get off this planet much less back on course. I don't have time to...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: John, just listen to him. it doesn't matter what he's saying. Just listen. Sometimes, at least in the eyes of their fathers, little boys have to come first.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As soon as we get back into space, we're going to spend some real time together. I promise. Maureen looks out the window. A long beat. Then she smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's nice to have our family under one roof. Even if we had to go half way across the galaxy to manage it. John presses a button, the blast shield opening to reveal the stacked orbs of three glowing moons. Maureen smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How would you feel about a little late night tutorial, Professor? John moves to her, begins pulling her down, out of FRAME.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mm. That's new. What are you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Going for extra credit. EXT.-JUPITER TWO-NIGHT The ship sits on the alien landscape.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good night John.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good night Maureen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good night Judy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good night Will.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good night Penny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You guys have got to be kidding. CHAPTER 17: The Core -------------------- INT.-JUPITER TWO-BRIDGE-MORNING Will comes up on the elevator, rubbing his eyes, first awake in the morning. He stumbles to the viewscreen. WILL-CLOSE. His eyes widen with shock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh man. REVERSE ANGLE A giant portal shimmers at snow's edge about 100 yards from the ship. Beyond it, a sun-stained field of towering plants and trees. INT.-BRIEFING ROOM The crew gathers at the table. (OVER) a RUMBLING. The ship shakes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are those rumblings? They've been happening all morning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How can half the landscape have grown up overnight?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, let's get settled. Maureen? MAUREEN'S MONITOR-CLOSE. A geothermal analysis shows the giant plates that make up this world appear mismatched.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's impossible. But this planet's geothermic plates don't match up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was afraid of this. Al1 eyes turn to John.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think these tremors are the result of opening and closing doorways.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doorways to where?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The future.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perhaps the Professor was hit on the head when we landed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Remember the portal that lead us to the probe ship? What if we crossed a into a time years after Earth sent a rescue mission.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not serious? Time travel is impossible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No it's not. It's just improbable. Like hyperdrive was a hundred years ago. Nothing's really impossible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This world could be riddled with doorways to the future.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So if we walk into that forest outside, we're really just walking into this crater years from now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Geological plates from different times wouldn't fit together. That would explain the tectonic mismatch. But doorways in time, John?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If these portals are opening and closing, part of some cascading, natural phenomenon, they could be tearing this planet apart
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These portals are exactly what I predicted my time machine would do. What if the doorways aren't natural? A machine that bends space, like our hyperdrive, could be modified to bend time as well. What if someone on this world has built a device?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Son, I appreciate your input but now isn't the time for flights of fancy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You never listen to me. Not ever. And with that Will storms out. John stares after him a beat, sorely wanting to follow. (OVER) another RUMBLE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's no telling how long before this planet breaks up entirely. (rising). Don and I are going to locate the radioactive material for the core. Get the ship ready to go. We may have very little time. INT. -BRIDGE John, suited up, heads for the open front hatch when he spots Will sitting alone in the Com chair, tinkering with his deck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aren't you coming out to say goodbye? Will just shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're always leaving. What if... Will looks away, finally giving voice to his worst fear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What if one time you don't come home... John stares at his son, unsure what to say, the boy's anguish so deep and apparent. He reaches into his shirt, takes off his dog tags.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whenever your grandfather went away on a mission, held leave these with me. For safe keeping. And when he got home I d always be waiting to give them back. He lifts the chain and places it around the boy's neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm coming back Will. I promise. Will is silent. John touches the boy's hair, then walks out. A beat. Will looks up after his father, fingering the dog tags. EXT.-JUPITER TWO The Robinsons, all except Will, stand-gathered around the front of the ship. Don has a small tracking device in his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've got a fix on the radioactive material. It's through the portal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll just have to hope the doorways remain stable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These crater walls are disabling the com-links. You won't be able to communicate with the ship. (OVER) the ground shakes again. Maureen Come home to me, Professor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love you, wife. John kisses her. Don looks at Judy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going to regret saying this, But try to get back in one piece.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is kind of a kiss for luck occasion, wouldn't you agree, Doc?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See. I'm regretting it already. (coy) Kisses have to be earned. Say goodbye, Blip. Blip reaches up and touches John's face. Then her CHIRPS form a rough approximation of the words Penny taught her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice girl. Pretty girl. Nice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You take care of her, Penny. (kisses her head) Take care of you too, baby. Then the two men bead off, towards the portal and forest beyond. PULL BACK TO REVEAL Smith stares out the cabin window. PUSH IN as INT.-SMITH'S CELL SMITH Yes, enjoy your moments of trite familial bonding. He turns, heads back to his table, transformed now, into a makeshift lab, the stolen control bolt in mid-modification.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because they will be your last. INT.-WILL'S CABIN The beginnings of Will's home-made robot sits on the table. WILL is in the f.g. riffling his PERSONAL CARGO container. Penny ENTERS, an assortment of small electronic devices, hairclips, and other metal and electronic objects. Dumps them on the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's everything even close to nonessential. Even my bellybutton ring.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks, Pen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want to come on a land survey? But Will just shakes his head, sulky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, what does dad know? Maybe someone did build a time machine. She ruffles his hair. Disappears. Will activates a CPU speaker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Robot is on line. (OVER) a KNOCKING has begun. WILL looks up, puzzled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It sounds like old morse code. Chapter 18: Danger Will! ------------------------ INT.-CORRIDOR Will walks down the corridor. (OVER) The KNOCKING continues. Will follows the SOUND until he comes to the door of Smith's prison. Smith is visible through the door window, sitting at a table, hammering out the code with his boot. He beckons Will inside. Will shakes his head. Smith begins TAPPING again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sounding out the code) Danger. INT.-SMITH'S CELL The door slides open and Will ENTERS, a laser pistol in hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said someone is in danger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We all are. You are wise to arm yourself. Smith eyes the weapon, moving towards the boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This gun is set to fire for me only so don't try anything funny. Smith barely misses a beat as he adjusts, passing the child, going instead to the window and opening the blast shield.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: William, you misjudge me. I only want to help you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Help us? You tried to kill us all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But now our fates are intertwined. if your father and that idiot West fail, I will have no chance of getting home. It is in my best interests they succeed. And I always follow my best interests. Smith gazes out at the exotic terrain. (OVER) an inhuman WAIL.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What monsters roam these alien wilds? Fools. To set off blindly across this savage land. Much as I hate to admit it, it will be harder to manage without them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you talking about? They'll be back. They'll be okay. Smith is silent. A long, lethal beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Someone should go after them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will, I forbid it. You're a boy. A clever one, certainly, but a child nonetheless. This planet is likely full of predators. Even if you found them, what if they're hurt, ravaged, dying, what good could you do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you're a doctor. Smith turns away, hiding his smile. EXT.-JUPITER TWO-DAY Judy and Maureen are hanging on repelling lines before the crater wall, shipping away ore that glitters like diamonds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's impossible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not really. Geologists have speculated that Dimondium might be naturally occurring in many older worlds. Part of a biosphere's way of rejuvenating itself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This one is ten times more powerful then that on Alpha Prime. There's enough here to save Earth. Penny stands in the f.g. with Blip on her arm, taking plant samples, talking into her video recorder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After much deliberation, the Space Captive has decided to accept her new role as member of the crew. The Robinsons, after all, can  obviously use her help... Blip jumps up on Penny's arm, knocking her recorder to the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (flaring) Now look what you've done. Stop hanging all over me. Blip stares at her, frightened by her tone, begins backing away to the edge of the forest. She looks at Penny, then disappears into the thick brush..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blip. Wait. I'm sorry. Damn. Penny heads after the creature. HOLD on her recorder. Forgotten. CHAPTER 19: A Different Future ------------------------------ EXT.-PLANET'S SURFACE-DAY Will and Smith are walking down a forest path. The boy has a radiation tracker in his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've got a fix on Dad's suit beacon. Dead ahead is a field of beautiful, alien flowers, their purple leaves moving in the wind like an azure sea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow, that's Mom's favorite color.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How droll. (OVER) a tremendous RUMBLING. The WIND ROARS. Suddenly, the air in the distance begins to twist, a rushing distortion sweeping towards them, flowers growing, landscape aging rapidly within.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Run, child, run. Smith turns, begins to flee, pulling Will with him, away from the rushing warp. Smith trips, falls, closes his eyes, waiting for the distortion to overtake him. A beat. He opens his eyes. SMITH-POV. A glowing, stationary portal shimmers behind him, revealing beyond a forest ever older, darker, more overgrown.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will? Will? No sign of the boy. Then, from behind a tree, Will appears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow! The field across the portal has is now a mass of giant plants, the flowers a deep red. Will rushes across the rip in space.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: William, wait!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See, over here I'm in the future. (steps back towards Smith) Here I'm in the past. Don't worry. If my theories are correct, these doorways should remain stable, for a while anyway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can barely contain my glee. Why aren't you aging like the plants?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's just an effect of the portals forming. Once they stabilize you can cross from one time to another just like stepping between two rooms. (off his tracker) Dad's signal is this way. Come on, Doctor Smith. Will takes Smith's hand, pulls him across the threshold. SMITH-POV. Where he stands is now lush, the sky overhead a glowing crimson. Yet behind him, the path in as it originally appeared. Younger. The sky, bright. Will has run deeper into the brush. Smith notices something by his feet. He clears away the brush, revealing shapes beneath the foliage. His expression darkens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did you find? Will has returned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come, come, son, no time for distractions. Let's move on. Smith shoves Will on, the boy unable to see what Smith saw. PAN DOWN. Headstones. Each bears a marking, the names still legible. Maureen, Penny and Judy Robinson. EXT.-PLANET'S SURFACE-DAY-PRES John and Don emerge from the brush. They have come to one of the crater walls. John looks from the rock face to his tracker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn? Damn is not good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The radiation signature we've been tracking. it's a  ghost. A reflection from the Jupiter Two bouncing off the ore in these walls. There's no core material here. (OVER) a sudden RUMBLING. The ground shakes. The ROAR of WIND. A time portal rushes towards them like a glittering maw, the side of the crater aging and crumbling in it's wake. John and Don race away from the distortion, ducking falling trees, roll clear as the portal stabilizes, now a fixed doorway to a darker, more deserted future.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The ship's back that way. we have to go through. EXT.-BRUSH-DAY-PRESENT Penny is pushing through the forest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blip? I'm sorry. Blip? She spots the tiny creature ahead in the distance. Blip SNIFFS the ground, runs a few steps. SNIFFS again. Looks up. There, before Blip is another glittering hole in time. The forest beyond is far thicker, the sky red. Blip steps through the portal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blip, wait. Penny goes to the edge of the portal, stares at the monstrously tall trees beyond. A beat. Then she steps through, following. EXT.-CRATER CAVES-FUTURE Penny pushes through dwindling brush to a series of rocky overhangs and caverns cut into the crater wall. BLIP is standing over a large circular stone, hopping up and down, CHIRPING and BLIPPING madly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blip, you can't run off like that. (closing on the stone) What the-? THE STONE-CLOSE. A series of hieroglyphs are painted on the giant rock, their images the same style as those on the probe ship. HIEROGLYPH ONE-CLOSE. A mighty battle in space is depicted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some kind of fight, in space. It almost looks like the probe ship Major West blew up. HIEROGLYPH TWO-CLOSE. A fiery star falls to the planet's surface.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That could be the Jupiter Two crash landing. HIEROGLYPH THREE-CLOSE. Here a dark haired beauty holds a single lizard monkey aloft, her face remarkably like Penny's. Suddenly BLIP begins to SHRIEK. (OVER) RUSTLING leaves. SHAPES are moving in the trees, the vague outline of camouflaged forms dropping to the ground. Five figures suddenly de-camouflage. Lizard monkeys, two large, two smaller. Directly in front of Penny, the largest monkey de-camouflages. Fully grown, the beast is nearly twice Penny's height. Around the creature's wrist is something odd. An old, tattered green ribbon. BLIP begins to SCREAM and SHRIEK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blip, no! Too late. Blip leaps on the giant creature, grabs the ribbon. The beast could slap Blip away like a fly. But the creature doesn't resist, just stares down at Blip with something akin to tenderness. Blip looks at the ribbon in his hand. Then at the one around her wrist. Save for their age difference., the ribbons are identical. The giant monkey moves forward, closing on a petrified Penny, paw reaching out, touching her face. The beast begins stroking Penny's cheek in a familiar gesture of comfort.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice girl. Pretty girl. Nice. Penny stares up in stunned wonder. EXT.-PLANET'S SURFACE-EVENING-FUTURE Don and John are crossing the brush. The terrain in growing ever more desolate, desert like. The double suns hang on the horizon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We should be able to see the ship. Something catches the light on the ground beside them. Don reaches down and lifts a small metal fragment in his hand. METAL-CLOSE. On it is the familiar logo of the United Space Agency.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Could these be from the probe?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Corroded. This metal is decades old. Don finds another piece of wreckage, turns it over in his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not possible. WRECKAGE-CLOSE. The fragment bears a simple legend: Jupiter Two.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What kind of nightmare is this? Where the hell are we?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, Major, when the hell are we? Suddenly Don is hit in the chest with a plasma charge, goes flying. John ducks and rolls, FIRING his laser from behind the cover of a rocky mound. John goes up to take another SHOT, is bit with a powerful electrical blast, falling hard. Still. REVERSE ANGLE Rolling out from behind him, claws extended in attack Position and apparently many years old, is a rebuilt Robot. EXT.-PLANET'S SURFACE-EVENING-FUTURE Will and Smith are crossing the alien terrain. The plants have given way to desert. The suns hang low in the crimson sky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I feel like we got turned around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just follow your father's signal, young William.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh shit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A boy of your intelligence shouldn't swear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pointing) Look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. Shit, indeed. REVERSE ANGLE. At the edge of the crater wall sits the wrecked hull of the Jupiter Two. The lower sections are gone, the hull scarred, open to the sun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : JOHN-CLOSE. Stirring to consciousness. WIDER INT.-JUPITER TWO BRIDGE-FUTURE Or what is left of it. Dark. The occasional COMPUTER panel flickers Shattered monitors. An awful history-told in torn metal. John is slumped in a corner, Don still on the floor beside him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, well. All things really do come to he who waits. A FIGURE sits in the command chair, visage obscured by shadow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is this place?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why Professor, the shock must have scrambled your brain. Look around you. Don't you recognize the spot? You've come home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This can't be... But even as the words cross his lips, he knows it is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What have you done to the ship. ...Where's my family?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your family is dead. Dead and in the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What fickle consort in memory. Time dims certain images while others shine clear and bright as yesterday. The figure stands, light hitting his face. Late thirties. Long blond hair, a shaggy beard and moustache. Eerily familiar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll never forget that morning. Twenty years ago. What was it you said? I'll be back. I promise. But I knew better. You never came home. The figure walks to one of the burned out panels.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Without you, your family never had a chance. A few spidersv survived the destruction of the probe ship. They reached the planet and attacked. I can still hear the women scream.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who are you? The figure walks forward, into the light. Stands there a moment. Then he lifts something hanging around his neck. Tarnished metal, old but familiar. John's father's dog tags.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you recognize me, Dad? It's me. I'm your son. Will. EXT.-CRATER CAVES-DAY Maureen and Judy, lasers drawn, are pushing through the brush.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Penny? Penny? The four lizard monkeys are kneeling in a circle around Penny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Penny? Baby, are you alright? Penny rises, steps forward, carrying Blip. The other beasts hang back, their faces genuflecting, almost reverential.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's okay, Mom. They're not going to hurt us. it's like  they think I'm their princess or something.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: L O S T I N S P A C
A GIANT SNOW COVERED MOUNTAIN RANGE
